body.name: ROADOM Touch Screen Monitor with Case, 7’’ Raspberry Pi Screen, IPS FHD 1024×600,Responsive and Smooth Touch,Dual Built-in Speakers,HDMI Input,Compatible with Raspberry Pi 5/4/3/Zero,Versatile Stand
body.merchantInfo: Sold by ROADOM-US and Fulfilled by Amazon.
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 5 hrs 7 mins
features: 💚[IPS FHD Resolution & 178° Full Viewing Angle] Experience stunning visuals with ROADOM's touchscreen monitor boasting a 1024*600 FHD resolution, upgradable to 1920*1080. Unlike standard 800*480 displays, our IPS panel offers vivid colors and a wide 178° viewing angle. For optimal image quality and touch responsiveness, consider removing the pre-installed screen protector.

💚[Responsive, Accurate and Smooth Touch] Enjoy swift, precise touch interactions thanks to a rapid 3-5 ms response time. ROADOM's Raspberry Pi monitor supports 5-point capacitive touch and intuitive gestures like tapping, zooming, and mouse clicks. This mini monitor effortlessly integrates with various operating systems, requiring no additional drivers - just plug and play.

💚[Widely Compatible with Various Devices and OS] Designed for Raspberry Pi enthusiasts, our 7 inch monitor suits all Raspberry Pi versions, including Raspberry Pi 5/4/3/Zero. Compatible with Octo Pi, Banana Pi, Retro Pi, game consoles (XBOX/PS4/PS5), computers, TV boxes, and more. While this small monitor works seamlessly with Windows, Noobs, Debian, Ubuntu, and Kodi, please note that touch functionality is disabled on IOS systems.

💚[Dual Built-In Speakers & Protective Case] Immerse yourself in rich audio with dual built-in speakers. We've enhanced the 10.1-inch monitor by integrating the circuit board, screen, and casing, ensuring all-around protection. No more exposed circuit boards! Plus, the larger 10.1'' size is perfect for video streaming and game emulation enthusiasts.

💚[Versatile Stand & Comprehensive Accessories] Customize your viewing experience with the included versatile stand, adjusting height and tilt angles to your preference. Our package provides everything you need for seamless Raspberry Pi touchscreen integration, including essential cables. Effortlessly mount your Raspberry Pi directly on the monitor's back, ensuring a clean setup and efficient cable management.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very impressed for use with my Pi 5
reviews.reviewText: I just got this, and I love it. It is connected via the included angled HDMI cable and USB-C power/touch cable. I have a 27W supply.This device has a nice industrial design and just feels solid.My Pi 5 has a heavy-duty GeekWorm heatsink with passive cooling and two fans. This would not mount in the prescribed way since it is designed for a bare board. For now, I used double-sided sticky tape. I am also waiting for my M2 board and drive. I will have to look for a more permanent solution then.I am tempted to get the 10" version, since this is so nice. But I like the current small size.Audio volume could be a little higher, too.But a great product surpassing my expectations.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Purchased for the raspberry pi just just testing it out with my laptop. I'm very impressed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Bought for ONE purpose: play Music Blu-rays and DVDs from a Reavon without having to deal with my giant TV screen being on.It works!Image quality is excellent...meaning small print is very legible.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars IPS & Touch In One
reviews.reviewText: As some other reviewers have said the colors are a little washed out especially for an IPS (7"), but it looks better than some other tablets with supposed IPS screens so maybe it’s just the luck of the silicon. I didn’t have the best of luck with the touch features: even after calibration it will still register every other touch so if it wasn’t mission critical this could be a good solution. I really liked having the built-in speakers and the stand which made this a nice little standalone solution for my Pi and as a secondary monitor for a laptop. I noticed some pretty serious ghosting when just playing Solitaire though so probably more of a static display than a portable gaming powerhouse.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome LCD for the price
reviews.reviewText: Works fantastic and flawlessly on my raspberry pi 4b on my ROS robot works fantastic with the battery supply. This is running out of 4400 cell series battery.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic option to turn your RPi4 into a touchscreen workstation or dashboard!
reviews.reviewText: I really like this touchscreen monitor and it was the exact companion I needed for my raspberry pi 4. It comes with all of the wires needed and then some. I returned my first one for the screen being faulty. But, so far, the replacement has been completely solid. You will likely need to do some software/package installation to calibrate the touchscreen and have easy access to a virtual keyboard.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great little monitor. Very compact.
reviews.reviewText: Great little monitor. Works with my raspberry pi and as a second monitor for my Mac.Packaging was good. Everything is protected during shipping. Comes with a bunch of connector cables. The little stand needs to be slid into a slot in the back. It's a very snug fit.Use as a secondary monitor: Yes it works just fine, although 7 inches might be a little small for most use cases, the screen was perfectly viewable and detailed. I watched a short video on it to test. Audio through the speakers was decent. I connected a external headset and that worked fine too. There was some low level noise, but that might have been from my headphones. No popping noises or anything like that. My Mac mini had no problem detecting and connecting to it through the provided HDMI cable. The hdmi cable was a tight fit to connect to the monitor - and that's a bit of a theme for this product in general. Everything is an almost too tight a fit.Raspberry Pi usage: Yes. First, I LOVE that it came with a screwdriver and 5 screws (1 extra in case you lose one) to attach your raspberry pi. This product was good at providing all the little extra accessories that you need. I hit a slight hiccup in getting the HDMI and touch screen cables connected. The cables are very short and there is very little space between the raspberry pi and the stand that connects to the monitor. Easy enough to work around, you remove the stand, connect the power and HDMI cables, and then reattach the monitor to the stand. I did NOT try powering the raspberry pi with the 3 wire GPIO cable they provided, for the simple reason that I would need to verify the connections independently. I know there are two red wires and a black one, and I just didn't want to double check this when the other cables were already provided. AND touch screen functionality works just fine.automatically. I also really like that the raspberry pi mounts on on the back of the monitor.User guide: Okay-ish. The weakest part of the product is that the provided paper instruction guide only shows connecting the raspberry pi with the 5V gpio cable and the 4-wire touch cable. Arguably, that's the only connection method that you really-really need a picture of, but I would have liked it if the manual included the connection images that you see in the Amazon sales page.Summary: I've tried out a few small different monitors for raspberry pi over the years, and this is probably my favorite so far. Easy to setup, does all the basics and then some. Going in, I was a little suspicious about the touch screen part working without any setup, but it works just fine. I didn't need to do anything to get that working. Just how I like it. I would recommend to anyone you is in the market for a small monitor for their raspberry pi, or any other time you need a small monitor.
